intro: Cordylanthus tenuis, commonly known as slenderleaf filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers in spring. Cordylanthus tenuis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, well-drained conditions.
